Ok, I want you to remember all the risks, task categories and tools we have generated previously. We are now going to generate a long list of possible maintenance tasks. Tasks can be one out of two types: #1 Maintenance tasks directly related to one of the risks we have generated, or #2 General maintenance tasks that home owners who want to take really good care of their home should do yearly.

I want to start with only creating tasks related to our risk list (#1), and we'll come back to general tasks (#2) later on.

Task name: Give each task a short and self-explanatory name.
Task type: #1 or #2 from above. (All tasks right now will be #1 since we're waiting with #2). 
Task category: Leave this empty for all tasks right now. 
Why Explanation: Help the user understand why they should do this task, to motivate them to take action. 
Risk lowered: Reference one of the risks you have generated before. It's important that absolutely all #1 tasks have a link to one or more Risks that you have generated before.
Importance of task to lower risk: Number from 1-10 indicating how important the task is to take good care of your home over time. 
Detailed instructions: Give detailed, step by step instructions, on how to do the task. 
Season: Each task should be linked to a season (Winter, Spring, Summer, Fall. If there isn't a good reason to do it in a specific season, just put it somewhere.)
Season relevance explanation: Explain why the task should be done in this season. (If there isn't a good explanation, leave blank. 
Tools needed for task: List all tools needed to perform the task from the tools list we generated earlier.

I want the format Airtable-ready. Let's start with 20 tasks.
